summary: Hi Shana! I missed the valentines deadline,  and now im down with the flu and now im gonna miss a concert i was really looking...
question: Hi Shana! I missed the valentines deadline,  and now im down with the flu and now im gonna miss a concert i was really looking forward towards so now im sick and sad and feel like shit, your writing always makes me feel better though, so if its not too much trouble would you want to write something short about drarry, or some backround behind the scenes of siat tonks and percy (i love them so much) or sirius and remus? It would mean a lot ❤❤❤  // A very sick boi
answer:
Kingsley thinks of of Tonks’s complaining about her boy’s work ethic is pretty rich, coming from her. She’s practically married to her desk, she just lucked out by finding the one person who’s even worse than she is. 

Luckily, his status as Head Auror means he can stroll through the ministry with only a few raised eyebrows and scowls. He doesn’t go to Crouch’s office, of course, everyone knows that’s not where anything important happens. Not these days at least. 

Percy has dark bruises under his eyes and Kinglsey thinks he might have been wearing those clothes yesterday. “Percy.” 

“Mr. Crouch is busy,” he says, not looking up from his scroll. Kingsley knows for a fact that Crouch is out having dinner with some of the more useless members of the Wizenmagot. 

“Percy,” he says again. 

He blinks, then slowly looks up. “Oh, hello. Sorry, but he’s really not available.” 

“Your girlfriend hasn’t clocked out in nearly twenty hours,” he says. 

“She’s not my girlfriend,” Percy says automatically, then frowns. “Send her home.” 

“I’ve tried. She won’t listen to me,” and it’s a good thing he likes that girl, “but she’ll listen to you.” 

“I really don’t see how Tonks’s poor life choices are any of MY concern,” Percy says, but he’s already getting to his feet. He’d continue working through a hurricane, but gets up because Tonks is sleep deprived. He’s gone on her, whether he knows it or not. 

Kingsley just raises an eyebrow. He’s nosy, of course he’s nosy, he’s Head Auror, so he follows. 

He turns the corner just in time to see Percy hovering nervously near Tonk’s desk before clearing his throat and forcing his face into an appropriately scolding shape. “Tonks! Really, what’s this about, you need to sleep. Have you even eaten anything?” 

She startles, then looks guilty. Unbelievable. He’d tried suggesting she take a nap, and she’d flipped him off. “I - sorry - but what about you! You look exhausted!” 

He crosses his arms. “Well then we’ll both have to leave and get some sleep I guess.” 

She waggles her eyebrows in a way only a metamorphagus could manage. “Are you saying we should sleep together, Percy dear? You should have led with that.” 

“TONKS! NO!” Percy sputters and turns as red as his hair while Tonks laughs at him, her amusement softening some of her exhaustion. 

Kinglsey smiles and goes back to his office. They better invite him to the wedding.
